definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: There are also humanitarian uses for sniffer bees.
sentences.chinese: 嗅探蜂还能应用于人道主义援助。

sentences.english: The dog was sniffing (at) the lamp-post.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗在灯柱旁嗅来嗅去。

sentences.english: The dog was sniffing (at) the lamp-post.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗在灯柱旁嗅来嗅去。

sentences.english: When he had said it , he took a culminating pinch of Snuff , and put his box in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 说完他嗅了最后一撮鼻烟，然后把鼻烟盒塞进了口袋。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the migration, effect on axon growth of olfactory ensheathing cells (OECs) transplanted in contused spinal cord of rats.
sentences.chinese: 目的明确移植的嗅鞘细胞在脊髓内的迁移特点。

sentences.english: Three bees are placed inside a shoe box-sized "sniffer box".
sentences.chinese: 这些蜜蜂被放进一只鞋盒大小的“嗅探盒”中。

sentences.english: In me the tiger sniffle the rose.
sentences.chinese: 我心里有猛虎在细嗅蔷薇。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the immunologic characters of human olfactory ensheathing cells (OECs).
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨人嗅鞘细胞的免疫学特征。

sentences.english: He lifted a lock of my hair and sniffed at it delicately.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起我的一缕头发，优雅地轻嗅着。

sentences.english: Such as wiretapping mode called "sniffer base on intermix mode".
sentences.chinese: 这种窃听方式为“基于混杂模式的嗅探”。

sentences.english: So dogs may be able to sniff out bombs. But they can’t pick up the smell of mendacity.
sentences.chinese: 所以，狗或许能够嗅出炸弹，却嗅不出谎言。

sentences.english: It took a few steps forward, and sniffed the sullen air.
sentences.chinese: 它试着向前迈了几步，嗅了嗅毫无生气的空气。

sentences.english: It took a few steps forward, and sniffed the sullen air.
sentences.chinese: 它试着向前迈了几步，嗅了嗅毫无生气的空气。

sentences.english: I sniffed the air, but I was pretending.
sentences.chinese: 我向空中嗅了嗅，不过那是装装样子。

definition: to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
